page.title: 06The Wheelwright(Brockhampton
page.content: The craft of the wheelwright is still carried out by Mr.M. Roberts the local blacksmith.He uses a large piece of elm to make the hub,turned in a lathe to shape.Twelve oak spokes and six fellies (the outside rim)with oak on ash are made by hand.Then a length of iron a little shorter than the outside rim of the wheel is joined together by heating in the forge.A large fire is made and the iron band heated to expand it.The wheel is placedon a band of iron (this band of iron been used for generations)and fastened down. When the band has expaned enough to fit one.The wheel it is quickly carried from the fire andplaced on the wheel.Cold water is quickly poured it in to the hot band to make it shrink and stop the wheel from burning at the same time large hammers are used to bang the band against the wheel.
